content:
The background colour can be set with css (see picture): 

.spaces-toolbar {background-color: pink !important;}


Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, create a new folder named chrome, create a new document in chrome with a text editor, name it userChrome.css, Save as type: All files *.*, copy in the above code, change the colour as desired. Double-click toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets to true in Settings/General/Config. editor, restart TB.

Online css generator

video on how to create a css file (Firefox and TB)
creator: sfhowes

content:
Do you have an antivirus program scanning inside the profile folder. That would be the first place I would look for trouble in a situation like this. Create an exclusion in the antivirus for the Thunderbird profile folder.

Clear the system temp folder. Clear the Thunderbird cache. There is a button in the troubleshooting information on the help menu for that. Restart The computer. If you have an antivirus that is bogged down scanning the moved mails it will not back off without a restart.

Then consider using archive instead of trying to move mail. Note particularly to option to store messages by year and with the original folder structure. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/archived-messages
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Yes the problem is antivirus. They use a old hacking technique called man-in-the-middle to do their scanning of encrypted connections. As this style of hacking requires the hacker to impersonate "you" the antivirus folk generate self signed encryption certificates to do so. Thunderbird however only trusts certificates issues by legitimate members of the chain of trust. Not something Norton or Kaspersky generates on the fly.

Personally I do not recommend email scanning as it really does very very little to improve security over simply allowing the antivirus to scan the attachments when you try and open them. Just have a look at Microsoft Defender, no email scanner at all and it is what I use these days.

Just remember is you are in the USA you need to remove the Kaspersky. They are subject to some import ban or whatever. I am not from the USA, but the news has made it to me.

Also be aware that the use of a VPN can mess things up to no end and Norton are flogging theirs heavily.

The only bug I am aware of in the 128 release related to this sort of thing is https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1903135 and it is fixed in 128.1

As for your image issue, images in emails must be decoded into files and saved somewhere to display. This somewhere is the system temp folder. On windows this is a disaster waiting to happen, especially as Windows makes no attempts to manage the mess of abandoned temp files. Older systems can have a hundred thousand files in this folder and access becomes slow leading to some odd outcomes. It is one of the causes or that old wives tale of windows systems slowing down over time.

Open the Windows file manager, type %temp% into the location bar. This will open the system temp folder. With as many applications closed as possible select everything in the temp folder (CtrL+A) and press the delete key. Any files in use will not delete, but generate a prompt, hence the less you have open the less of those you should see. Then see if things improve post this cleanup.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
There is not, and never has been, a "collapse folders" menu item.

There are two ways to collapse/expand 1. double click on a folder 2. click on the > or \/ (upside down caret) widget to the left of the folder name.

creator: firefox170

content:
I've been trawling through bug reports regarding version 115* and the Density settings. I've been trying to find out what's been going on and why.

You have to bare in mind that everything is sized by pixel size and needs to work on different OS and also computers/ monitors do not all have the same size set for a pixel. If you changed the screen resolution on computer (I'm not suggesting this is required) you would find the space would increase or decrease depending upon resolution settings because they alter the size of a pixel.

The Folder Pane and the Message List both are effected by the same font size and density settings. So size etc has to work in both locations. You also have to make sure the UI is inclusive in design meaning suitable for a variety of needs and user abilities. The icons etc use 16x16

Bug reports took this sort of form: There were quite a few complaints that the compact was too compact in 115* compared to a previous version - not enough space between items, so difficult to read. In some reports the Compact setting was having issues with Message List - not scrolling correctly so items at the bottom could not be accessed. Another real problem was the Bottom of gpqj letters (descenders) is cut off when compact density is used. - Conclusion was the row height/density to be font size dependant.

In 115* as an example font size 16px with compact starts to cut of letters. You must use 15px or less. I can easily reproduce that issue. It's not just about the Density, you have to consider what people may choose for Font Size and also take into consideration the space required for the various icons and extra display when something is selected or not.

So it seems the 115* compact worked perfectly for some people (like you and me) under specific conditions but equally caused readibility issues for others, so a compromise in design was made to find an optimum that satisfied all the important issues.

Basically the height of spacing needed to be modified in order to fix a variety of bugs which caused various usability issues.

Also the new design in Supernova 115* now has a thin blue line around outer edge of a selected folder which uses a couple of pixels.

This explains what has occured and why.
creator: Toad-Hall

creator: firefox170

content:
Try this: You may need to alter a preference in Config Editor 

*    Settings > General
  • Scroll to bottom and click on 'Config Editor' button
  • In search type : legacy
  • look for this line: toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets
  • If it is set as 'false' :
  • click on the far right arrow type icon to toggle from 'false' to say 'TRUE'

In Thunderbird

  • Help > Troubleshooting Information
  • in 'Application Basics' - Profile Folders - click on 'Open Folder'

A new window opens showing the contents of your profile name folder.

  • Exit Thunderbird now. This is important.


  • In the 'profile name ' folder create a new folder and call it 'chrome'. The spelling is important - note it is all lower case.
  • Then open a simple text editor program such as 'Notepad'.
  • Copy all the text between the lines below and paste it into 'Notepad'. 
/* FOLDER PANE  row height */ li[is="folder-tree-row"] { 	line-height: 18px !important; }

Save as 'userChrome.css' in 'chrome' folder

Start Thunderbird

REport on results.

Kind regards

content:
web.grafica.3d ha detto
il mio trigger per la cancellazione delle mail è stato far riparare la cartella, non la compattazione... ... Non c'è un'altra cache o simili dove trovare le mail?

La riparazione delle cartelle è una forma speciale di compattazione.

Se non avevi impostato la cancellazione dei messaggi dal server dopo il download, tutti i messaggi dovrebbero ancora essere sul server stesso (Thunderbird di default non cancella i messaggi, bisogna impostare appositamente il programma).

Se l'opzione Permetti a ricerca Windows di cercare nelle messaggi era attiva, potresti avere copia dei messaggi anche in singoli file (un file per ogni email).

content:
If it was unable to download the settings for gmail from https://autoconfig.thunderbird.net/v1.1/google.com that would indicate you have a firewall issue

Thunderbird does not "search" or probe for gmail accounts where the MX record for the domain is gmail or the email address is clearly gmail, it simply downloads the settings we know work from the link above.


So it is is unable to find settings for a gmail account it means that Thunderbird is unsuccessfully trying to access the link to get the settings. The most common causes of that are firewall, followed by DNS blocking of domains not on the corporate "approved" list.

content:
Wanted to follow-up on that. I was about to switch to Betterbird as this became almost unusable, but then I found a solution browsing some forums:

Exlude Thunderbird from Windows defender:

Go to 'Virus & threat protection' -> 'Manage setting' -> 'Add or remove exclusions' -> 'Add an exlusion' -> 'Process' -> "thunderbird.exe"

Running a couple of tests and seems that it is now about as fast as it used to be without getting in the 'Not responding' state whenever I receive an email on that IMAP account.

content: Op mijn C-schijf is nog bijna 500 GB vrij. In de Thunderbird profiel-map staan 2 submappen - kafkhz4j.default met een omvang van minder dan 1k en 1 bestand (times.json). - x9doa57g.default-release met een omvang van 243 Mb en een inhoud van 641 bestanden. Geeft dit enige info?
creator: kraakman-han

content: Dan is er nog de mogelijkheid dat dit een antwoord is van de mailserver. Kijk inderdaad eens hoe het met de schijfruimte is gesteld bij de provider. Is daar bijvoorbeeld een limiet bereikt?
creator: Mozilla-assistent

content: Dat had ik inderdaad ook al gecheckt. Omdat ik mails na 30 dagen van de server laat verwijderen staat er niet extreem veel op de server. Als ik inlog op webmail staat er dat ik 760 MB van de beschikbare 15 GB in gebruik heb.
creator: kraakman-han

content: Gebeurt dit ook in de probleemoplossingsmodus: https://support.mozilla.org/nl/kb/de-probleemoplossingsmodus-van-thunderbird?redirectslug=veilige-modus-thunderbird&redirectlocale=nl? En gaat dit om een 32- of 64-bits systeem? Dit in verband met de beperking van bestandsgrootte van 2GB voor 32-bits-systemen (lijkt niet van toepassing gezien de 243 MB). Check ook even de locatie van de local folders en probeer nogmaals Postvak IN en Verzonden te comprimeren.
creator: Mozilla-assistent

content:
Probleem treedt ook op in de probleemoplossingsmodus. Ook comprimeren helpt niet.

Het is Windows 11 home - 64 bit.

Lokale mappen staan volgens mijn account-instellingen onder serverinstellingen hier: C:\...\MaildataThunderbird\IenM_vanafAug2024 In die map staan overigens geen submap Local Folders en ook geen submap mail zoals bij mijn oude account het geval was.

In praktijk lijkt Thunderbird dit te gebruiken: C:\...\MaildataThunderbird\Local Folders

In de account-instellingen kan ik C:\...\MaildataThunderbird\IenM_vanafAug2024 echter niet aanpassen naar C:\...\MaildataThunderbird\Local Folders. Dat geeft de melding "De map die in de instelling voor Lokale map is opgegeven, wordt al gebruikt door de account ‘Lokale mappen’. Kies een andere map."

Er staat overigens vrijwel niets in C:\...\MaildataThunderbird\Local Folders.

content:
Hello there We have read the question We try to help

As you describe this situation, it is possible that you are a victim of ghostgolders or a common subject that you have unsubscribed from the relevant email folders. To fix this, you can try the following. This error has plagued Thunderbird for a long time and is a bug in the software section. Your folders may be in gray and appear printed or emerge.they may also be gone.this is also called ghostfolder. You can click on your account with the right mouse button and choose subscribe ( or subscribe).the folders / folders that will then be added to Voorschoten can be filled and so you will most likely get your folders back if you press ok next.

Greetings Firefox volunteer
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content:
Hello there

Or if your folders are no longer present at all, is that the question is whether they will come back? This method is that you move to the server settings and click on advanced there. In the where you are next you can choose to put the check mark next to )show only subscribed folders and click on OK , if the check mark does say delete it and click on okay.so you have to configure this option a bit for use of it. If you can, quit Thunderbird and restart . If all goes well and okay then the ghost folders are gone.if not, repeat the procedure several times if possible.

Greetings Firefox volunteer
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content:
Hello there

Do you use antivirus for your computer there are many cases of certain anti virus interfering with thunderbird folders which no longer work properly. Try creating an exception rule for your profile folder so that these profile folders are not temporarily scanned for the folders that have undergone this corruption can unfortunately no longer be recovered. What you can still do is perform a repair folder but as you say there are no more folders of these or you simply can no longer find them.

Greetings Firefox volunteer
creator: Googlethunderbird.
